member.name: M:_VL_Skia_.Graphics.Skia.Paths._Operations_.AddPath(SkiaSharp.SKPath,SkiaSharp.SKPath,SkiaSharp.SKPathAddMode,SkiaSharp.SKPath@)
member.summary: Extends the current path with the path elements from another path, using the specified extension mode.
member.param: Extends the current path with the path elements from another path, using the specified extension mode.
The path containing the elements to be added to the current path.

Determines how the Other path contours are added to the path. On F:SkiaSharp.SKPathAddMode.Append mode, contours are added as new contours. On F:SkiaSharp.SKPathAddMode.Extend mode, the last contour of the path is extended with the first contour of the Other path.
Extends the current path with the path elements from another path, using the specified extension mode.

member.summary: Closes the current contour.

member.name: M:_VL_Skia_.Graphics.Skia.Paths._Operations_.ConicTo(SkiaSharp.SKPath,Stride.Core.Mathematics.Vector2,Stride.Core.Mathematics.Vector2,System.Single,SkiaSharp.SKPath@)
member.summary: Add a conic path from the last point.
member.remarks:
## Remarks
If no <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPath.MoveTo%2A> call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0, 0).
member.param: Add a conic path from the last point.
The weight of the conic curve.
Add a conic path from the last point.

member.name: M:_VL_Skia_.Graphics.Skia.Paths._Operations_.CubicTo(Stride.Core.Mathematics.Vector2,SkiaSharp.SKPath,Stride.Core.Mathematics.Vector2,Stride.Core.Mathematics.Vector2,SkiaSharp.SKPath@)
member.summary: Adds a cubic bezier from the last point.
member.remarks:
## Remarks
If no <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPath.MoveTo%2A> call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0, 0).
member.param: Adds a cubic bezier from the last point.
Adds a cubic bezier from the last point.

member.name: M:_VL_Skia_.Graphics.Skia.Paths._Operations_.GetBounds(SkiaSharp.SKPath,SkiaSharp.SKPath@,Stride.Core.Mathematics.RectangleF@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Returns the bounds of the path's points.
member.remarks: This bounds may be larger than the actual shape, since curves do not extend as far as their control points. Additionally this bound encompasses all points, even isolated MoveTo either preceding or following the last non-degenerate contour.
member.param: Returns the bounds of the path's points.
Returns the bounds of the path's points.
Returns true if the path is not empty, otherwise false.

member.name: M:_VL_Skia_.Graphics.Skia.Paths._Operations_.GetTightBounds(SkiaSharp.SKPath,SkiaSharp.SKPath@,Stride.Core.Mathematics.RectangleF@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Gets the "tight" bounds of the path. Unlike SkiaSharp.SKPath.GetBounds(SkiaSharp.SKRect@), the control points of curves are excluded.
member.param: Gets the "tight" bounds of the path. Unlike SkiaSharp.SKPath.GetBounds(SkiaSharp.SKRect@), the control points of curves are excluded.
Gets the "tight" bounds of the path. Unlike SkiaSharp.SKPath.GetBounds(SkiaSharp.SKRect@), the control points of curves are excluded.
Returns true if the bounds could be computed, otherwise false.

member.name: M:_VL_Skia_.Graphics.Skia.Paths._Operations_.LineTo(SkiaSharp.SKPath,Stride.Core.Mathematics.Vector2,SkiaSharp.SKPath@)
member.summary: Add a line from the last point to the specified point (x, y).
member.remarks:
## Remarks
If no <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPath.MoveTo%2A> call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0, 0).
member.param: Add a line from the last point to the specified point (x, y).
Add a line from the last point to the specified point (x, y).

member.summary: Compute the result of a logical operation on two paths.

The logical operator.
Compute the result of a logical operation on two paths.

member.name: M:_VL_Skia_.Graphics.Skia.Paths._Operations_.QuadTo(SkiaSharp.SKPath,Stride.Core.Mathematics.Vector2,Stride.Core.Mathematics.Vector2,SkiaSharp.SKPath@)
member.summary: Add a quadratic bezier from the last point.
member.remarks:
## Remarks
Add a quadratic bezier from the last point, approaching control point (`x0`, `y0`), and ending at (`x1`, `y1`).
If no <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPath.MoveTo%2A> call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0, 0).
member.param: Add a quadratic bezier from the last point.
Add a quadratic bezier from the last point.

member.name: M:_VL_Skia_.Graphics.Skia.Paths._Operations_.Reset(SkiaSharp.SKPath,SkiaSharp.SKPath@)
member.summary: Clear any lines and curves from the path, making it empty.
member.remarks: This frees up internal storage associated with those segments.
member.param: Clear any lines and curves from the path, making it empty.
Clear any lines and curves from the path, making it empty.

member.name: M:_VL_Skia_.Graphics.Skia.Paths._Operations_.Rewind(SkiaSharp.SKPath,SkiaSharp.SKPath@)
member.summary: Clear any lines and curves from the path, making it empty.
member.remarks: Any internal storage for those lines/curves is retained, making reuse of the path potentially faster.
member.param: Clear any lines and curves from the path, making it empty.
Clear any lines and curves from the path, making it empty.

member.summary: Applies a transformation matrix to the all the elements in the path.
member.param: Applies a transformation matrix to the all the elements in the path.
Applies a transformation matrix to the all the elements in the path.

member.name: M:_VL_Skia_.Graphics.Skia.Paths._Operations_.ArcTo_Relative(SkiaSharp.SKPath,Stride.Core.Mathematics.Vector2,System.Single,SkiaSharp.SKPathArcSize,SkiaSharp.SKPathDirection,Stride.Core.Mathematics.Vector2,SkiaSharp.SKPath@)
member.summary: The same as SkiaSharp.SKPath.ArcTo(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,SkiaSharp.SKPathArcSize,SkiaSharp.SKPathDirection,System.Single,System.Single), but the coordinates are considered relative to the last point on this contour.
member.param: The same as SkiaSharp.SKPath.ArcTo(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,SkiaSharp.SKPathArcSize,SkiaSharp.SKPathDirection,System.Single,System.Single), but the coordinates are considered relative to the last point on this contour.
Determines whether the smallest or largest arc possible is drawn.
Determines if the arc should be swept in an anti-clockwise or clockwise direction.

The same as SkiaSharp.SKPath.ArcTo(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,SkiaSharp.SKPathArcSize,SkiaSharp.SKPathDirection,System.Single,System.Single), but the coordinates are considered relative to the last point on this contour.

member.name: M:_VL_Skia_.Graphics.Skia.Paths._Operations_.ArcTo(SkiaSharp.SKPath,Stride.Core.Mathematics.RectangleF,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean,SkiaSharp.SKPath@)
member.summary: Appends the specified arc to the path.
member.remarks:
## Remarks
If the start of the arc is different from the path's current last point, then an automatic <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPath.LineTo%2A> is added to connect the current contour to the start of the arc. However, if the path is empty, then we call <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPath.MoveTo%2A> with the first point of the arc.
member.param: Appends the specified arc to the path.
Whether to always begin a new contour with the arc.
Appends the specified arc to the path.

member.summary: Appends an elliptical arc from the current point in the format used by SVG.
member.param: Appends an elliptical arc from the current point in the format used by SVG.
Determines whether the smallest or largest arc possible is drawn.
Determines if the arc should be swept in an anti-clockwise or clockwise direction.
Appends an elliptical arc from the current point in the format used by SVG.

member.summary: Creates a raw iterator object to scan the all of the segments (lines, quadratics, cubics) of each contours in a path.
member.remarks:
## Remarks
Unlike the <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPath.CreateIterator%2A> method, this iterator does not clean up or normalize the values in the path. It returns the raw elements contained in the path.
member.param: Creates a raw iterator object to scan the all of the segments (lines, quadratics, cubics) of each contours in a path.

member.summary: Plays back a sequence of images from a given directory

member.param: Allows to specify a fallback texture in case loading fails (ie to show something other than white flashes)
The Id of the frame to display
A list of frame Ids that will be preloaded so they can be jumped to at any time
The step-size for reverse playback you'll be using for the Frame-to-Display input: e.g: 1 = normal speed, 2 = double speed, 3 = tripple speed,...
The step-size for forward playback you'll be using for the Frame-to-Display input: e.g: 1 = normal speed, 2 = double speed, 3 = tripple speed,...
The number of frames to preload for reverse playback
The Ids of the currently preloaded frames

The number of frames to preload for reverse playback
Playback speed multiplier: e.g: 1.0 = normal speed, 0.5 = half speed, 2.0 = double speed. Above 2, only whole, even numbers work correctly!
The Ids of the currently preloaded frames
